sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you could <radical>stop</radical> <radical>spoon</radical>ing water onto that <radical>tree</radical> we could use it for <kanji>brushwood</kanji>. But if you don't stop, then it will be too wet to burn at all! Stop already!
meaningInfo: We need to use that brushwood to make a fire! So stop spooning water on it!
readingMnemonic: You finally set the <kanji>brushwood</kanji> on fire and suddenly a <reading>Shiba</reading> (<ja>しば</ja>) Inu jumps out of the flames. So that's why they named this wood after them or... or vice versa?
readingInfo: Shiba inu's come from setting brushwood on fire! That must have been how they got their name!
